references.paper_title: A deployed quantal response-based patrol planning system for the us coast guard
references.reason: This paper is cited as a successful real-world application of Stackelberg games in the domain of security, which is a major motivation for this research.

references.paper_title: Commitment without regrets: Online learning in Stackelberg security games
references.reason: This paper is a key precursor to this research, addressing online learning in Stackelberg games, providing a foundation upon which this research builds.

references.paper_title: Learning and approximating the optimal strategy to commit to
references.reason: This paper is cited for its analysis of learning the leader's optimal strategy in Stackelberg games, providing context for the more complex side-information setting of this work.

references.paper_title: Learning optimal strategies to commit to
references.reason: This paper provides improved learning rates and lower bounds for learning optimal mixed strategies in Stackelberg games, adding to the body of knowledge that informs this research.

references.paper_title: Efficient algorithms for adversarial contextual learning
references.reason: This paper provides relevant background on contextual bandits and no-regret learning which is highly relevant to the contextual Stackelberg game problem addressed in this work.
